Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feedback] VS2017 enterprise check Budle Assemblies into Native Code, Localization not work" (#2178) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @samhouts on September 5, 2018 19:8_ ### Reproduction [TodoLocalized.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2372808/TodoLocalized.zip) If you set the Android project configuration to Release Mode and check "Bundle assemblies into native code" then localization doesn't work if you uncheck "Bundle assemblies into native code" then localization works 1) on the first page there's a picker at the top you can click to select different languages 2) select a different language 3) click on the PLUS arrow to go to the second page 4) the text on the buttons should now be in the language you selected This has come up before https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43787461/localization-doesnt-work-using-bundle-assemblies-into-native-code-in-release https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=55603 ### Description From Dev Community

xamarin.forms , Currently when build release Xamarin Android Apk then install app on device,it is run well ,but Localization is not work, it is only show system language(chinese) and english,when I change language to Korean ,it is show english not Korean . when i not check Budle Assemblies into Native Code,it is run well for Localization . project See Attachment Steps: 1.select release mode,check Budle Assemblies into Native Code ,then generate project 2.Archive the project and distribute 3.Install app on device,then open app, change language hope get help,thanks!

View on Developer Community
To find diagnostic information, see the original linked feedback ticket. ### Source [661459](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/661459) _Copied from original issue: xamarin/Xamarin.Forms#3718_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VS 2017 15.9.2 axml code broken" (#2455) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a pre-created file
2. Try to add a new property for any element (android:id for example)

### Expected Behavior
The editor continue working and I can type the value for property
### Actual Behavior
VS crashes without any sign of log file and reopens sometimes
### Version Information
15.9.2

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "jnimarshalmethod-gen.exe Windows support" (#2454) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: Added `monow.exe` to the `host-mxe-*` directories and to the bundle.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump Mono LLVM commit to include workaround for 32-bit mingw gcc compiler bug." (#2453) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Should fix https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2290.

Fix for crash in 32-bit llc.exe should be fixed by https://github.com/mono/llvm/pull/19. PR bumps to that commit in Mono LLVM release_60 branch.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "`AndroidSdkBuildToolsVersion` is not exported in binding projects" (#2452) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Looks like the msbuild property `AndroidSdkBuildToolsVersion` is not being exported in binding projects.

Here's a binlog with an example of it:

[binlog.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2605457/binlog.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to mono/mono/2018-06@b63e5378" (#2449) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
$ git diff --shortstat 709b46e3..b63e5378
	 14 files changed, 138 insertions(+), 77 deletions(-)

Various fixes, primarily for iOS.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VS2017 can not build xamarin android project if it has BuildNativeLibs target" (#2451) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a project which has additional pre-build step for building native android library by using ndk-build.

I want to add a dependency on "AndroidPrepareForBuild" target to check that all sdk paths have been resolved correctly before ndk-build call.

`
  <Target Name="BuildNativeLibs" DependsOnTargets="AndroidPrepareForBuild" Inputs="jni\Android.mk;jni\Application.mk" Outputs="@(AndroidNativeLibrary)">
    <Exec Command="$(AndroidNdkDirectory)\ndk-build -C jni" />
  </Target>
`

But after that VS can not build my project with some errors with resources:

`
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(7): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'icon' with value '@mipmap/ic_launcher').
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(7): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'label' with value '@string/app_name').
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(7): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'roundIcon' with value '@mipmap/ic_launcher_round').
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(7): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'theme' with value '@style/AppTheme').
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(8): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'label' with value '@string/app_name').
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(8): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'theme' with value '@style/AppTheme.NoActionBar').
`

Seems like I have some conflict with some another target which used for preparing resources.

NdkExample.zip attached.

### Note

This error can be avoided if move BuildNativeLibs target to separated Android binding project and use EmbeddedNativeLibrary instead of AndroidNativeLibrary

[NdkExample.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2603403/NdkExample.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Copy UITest for running UI tests" (#4517) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

After switching to PackageReference, we must also copy the UITest bits so CI can run it.

I believe this must be a temporary fix as it is CI's responsibility to download and manage it's tools - not the project

I know that Xamarin.forms suggest we should not use a navigation page wrap the masterdetailpage，but that is not flexible for a product.
Sometime I want use these for some product scene,And this work fine in android I tested which is Xamarin.forms 3.4.
And I know this feature is supported in uwp in Xamarin.forms 3.3.

I can not found the reopen button,so I start a new issue .

_Originally posted by @jingliancui in https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issue_comments#issuecomment-441140573_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[iOS] ImageButton border radius issue" (#4518) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

ClipsToBounds missing for ImageButton - that's the reason of bug.

### Issues Resolved ### 
- fixes #4511

### API Changes ###
None

### Platforms Affected ### 
- iOS

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
CornerRadius works

### Before/After Screenshots ### 
BEFORE:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10124814/48925518-726d2380-eed5-11e8-8747-f6c1c76ee3b3.png)


AFTER:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10124814/48925507-3afe7700-eed5-11e8-9eb6-9fc3c60bdd89.png)


### Testing Procedure ###
```csharp
MainPage = new ContentPage
{
	Content = new StackLayout
	{
		Children = {
			new ImageButton
			{
				VerticalOptions = LayoutOptions.CenterAndExpand,
				HorizontalOptions = LayoutOptions.CenterAndExpand,
				HeightRequest = 200,
				WidthRequest = 200,
				Source = "xamarinlogo",
				BackgroundColor = Color.Red,
				CornerRadius = 100
			}
		}
	}
};	
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "UWP frozen when set application mainpage after update to Xamarin.forms 3.4" (#4465) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Opened pull request "Copy UITest for running UI tests" (#4517) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

After switching to PackageReference, we must also copy the UITest bits so CI can run it.

I believe this must be a temporary fix as it is CI's responsibility to download and manage it's tools - not the project

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NSFormatter IsPartialStringValid issue" (#5171) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
I think there is an issue with

` public override bool IsPartialStringValid(ref string partialString, out NSRange proposedSelRange, string origString, NSRange origSelRange, out string error)`
 
as soon as you try to implement and is called app crashes with exception...

"Unable to marshal byref parameter type"

I also noted proposedSelRange in original signature is NSRangePointer so even if did work I would be unable to change cursor location

`- (BOOL)isPartialStringValid:(NSString **)partialStringPtr proposedSelectedRange:(NSRangePointer)proposedSelRangePtr originalString:(NSString *)origString originalSelectedRange:(NSRange)origSelRange errorDescription:(NSString **)error
`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Paths defined inside `Constants.*.cs.in` should be tested for existence " (#5047) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
See PR #5046 where a typo in the filename was not caught

We can only run that test on the latest version of the supported OS and we might have to ignore some cases like QuickTime removal...

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[tests] Add introspection tests for Constants.*.cs.in. Fixes #5047" (#5159) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Also fix the issues found by the test.

reference: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/5047
